Direct Known Subclasses:
DefaultSelectControl
public class SelectControl<T>
extends BaseSelectControl<T,T>

This class represents a select box (a.k.a. drop-down) control.

Author:
Jevgeni Kabanov (ekabanov@araneaframework.org), Martti Tamm (martti@araneaframework.org)
See Also:
Serialized Form

SelectControl

public SelectControl(String itemLabelProperty,
                     String itemValueProperty)
Creates a new instance of SelectControl with given label and value property names, which are both required.

Parameters:
itemLabelProperty - The property of select item to retrieve the label of select item (required).
itemValueProperty - The property of select item to retrieve the value of select item (required).
See Also:

itemValueProperty - The property of select item to retrieve the value of select item (required).
See Also:

SelectControl

public SelectControl(Class<T> itemClass,
                     String itemLabelProperty,
                     String itemValueProperty)
Creates a new instance of SelectControl, and also defines item class and label and value property names. Note that usually the class parameter is not needed. It is needed only when the select values are defined one-by-one with BaseSelectControl.addItem(String, String) method (then class is used to create new instances). The label and value property names are required.

Parameters:
itemClass - The class of the items stored in this select (needed when select values are defined one-by-one).
itemLabelProperty - The property of select item to retrieve the label of select item (required).
itemValueProperty - The property of select item to retrieve the value of select item (required).
See Also:
SelectControl(String, String)

SelectControl

                     Class<T> itemClass,
                     String itemLabelProperty,
                     String itemValueProperty)
Creates a new instance of SelectControl, and also defines item class, initial values, label and value property names. Note that usually the class parameter is not needed. It is needed only when the select values are defined one-by-one with BaseSelectControl.addItem(String, String) method (then class is used to create new instances). The label and value property names are required.

Parameters:
items - Predefined select items. May be null.
itemClass - The class of the items stored in this select (needed when select values are defined one-by-one).
itemLabelProperty - The property of select item to retrieve the label of select item (required).
itemValueProperty - The property of select item to retrieve the value of select item (required).
See Also:
SelectControl(List, String, String)

SelectControl

public SelectControl(List<T> items,
                     String itemLabelProperty,
                     String itemValueProperty,
                     String itemIsGroupProperty,
                     String groupChildrenProperty)
Creates a new instance of SelectControl, and also defines initial values, label and value property names. The label and value property names are required.

Optional properties for making use of <optgroup>s are itemIsGroupProperty and groupChildrenProperty. The former property, when specified, is checked on every display item, and when the property is true, the display item is considered to represent an <optgroup> (its label property is used for fetching the name of the group; its value property will be ignored). For every <optgroup> item, the groupChildrenProperty will be checked to retrieve items of type T in an array or List to fetch the <option>s for the group.

NB! Specifying itemIsGroupProperty and groupChildrenProperty to a select control can only be done through this constructor!

Parameters:
items - Predefined select items. May be null.
itemLabelProperty - The String property of select item to retrieve the label of select item (required).
itemValueProperty - The String property of select item to retrieve the value of select item (required).
itemIsGroupProperty - The Boolean property of select item to retrieve the condition value that this select item is a non-selectable <optgroup> containing other child <option>s (optional, but mandatory when groupChildrenProperty is provided).
groupChildrenProperty - The array/List<T> property of a group item to retrieve the child <option>s to render in the <optgroup> (optional, but mandatory when itemIsGroupProperty is provided).
See Also:
SelectControl(List, Class, String, String, String, String), BaseSelectControl.addItem(String, String)

SelectControl

public SelectControl(List<T> items,
                     Class<T> itemClass,
                     String itemLabelProperty,
                     String itemValueProperty,
                     String itemIsGroupProperty,
                     String groupChildrenProperty)
Creates a new instance of SelectControl, and also defines item class and label and value property names. Note that usually the class parameter is not needed. It is needed only when the select values are defined one-by-one with BaseSelectControl.addItem(String, String) method (then class is used to create new instances). The label and value property names are required.

Optional properties for making use of <optgroup>s are itemIsGroupProperty and groupChildrenProperty. The former property, when specified, is checked on every display item, and when the property is true, the display item is considered to represent an <optgroup> (its label property is used for fetching the name of the group; its value property will be ignored). For every <optgroup> item, the groupChildrenProperty will be checked to retrieve items of type T in an array or List to fetch the <option>s for the group.

NB! Specifying itemIsGroupProperty and groupChildrenProperty to a select control can only be done through this constructor!

Parameters:
items - Predefined select items. May be null.
itemClass - The class of the items stored in this select (needed when select values are defined one-by-one).
itemLabelProperty - The String property of select item to retrieve the label of select item (required).
itemValueProperty - The String property of select item to retrieve the value of select item (required).
itemIsGroupProperty - The Boolean property of select item to retrieve the condition value that this select item is a non-selectable <optgroup> containing other child <option>s (optional, but mandatory when groupChildrenProperty is provided).
groupChildrenProperty - The array/List<T> property of a group item to retrieve the child <option>s to render in the <optgroup> (optional, but mandatory when itemIsGroupProperty is provided).
See Also:
SelectControl(List, String, String, String, String), BaseSelectControl.addItem(String, String)
Method Detail

getSelectedItem

public T getSelectedItem()
Returns DisplayItem corresponding to selected element. Current value by which seleced element is determined is reported by the FormElement to which this SelectControl)belongs. If no FormElement is associated with SelectControl, this method returns null.

Returns:
DisplayItem corresponding to selected element.
Since:
1.0.5

getRawValueType

public DataType getRawValueType()
Description copied from interface: Control
This method should be overridden by the control, returning the type of the value of this control. It is later used in ConverterFactory to determine the BaseConverter used to transfer the values from Datato control and back.

Returns:
The type of the value of this control as specified in the given DataType object.
